Docs.summary: Encapsulates the state of an action that is currently executing.

remarks.para: The objects are immutable in CocosSharp. When the method is invoked, a new state object is created to keep track of the state of the object over time.
The CCActionState is initialized with both the immutable action (which provides the parameters for what the state should do) as well as the target node on which the state will operate.
If you are creating your own CCAction, you should also implement your own CCActionState and override at the method. Additionally, you can override also the , methods and the property.
